title: 105_hr2688
content: The Act may be cited as the "Economic Development Information Act of 1997". It includes findings and declarations. The "Economic Development Information Act of 1997" emphasizes the importance of accurate and timely information on economic development programs for the national economy and regions suffering from unemployment. Previous efforts by the Economic Development Administration have been successful in providing such information. The Economic Development Information Act of 1997 aims to expand the provision of economic development information to assist all areas suffering from economic distress. This includes access to various government and economic development resources in a format that is easily usable. The Economic Development Information Act of 1997 aims to provide access to government and economic development resources in a user-friendly format for areas experiencing economic distress. The Economic Development Information Act of 1997 aims to provide access to government and economic development resources in a user-friendly format for areas experiencing economic distress. Title VI of the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to include the creation of an Office of Economic Development Information. The Economic Development Information Act of 1997 amends Title VI of the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 to establish the Office of Economic Development Information within the Economic Development Administration. The Office serves as a central information clearinghouse for economic development programs and assists applicants in accessing financial and technical assistance. The Office of Economic Development Information was established to provide a central information clearinghouse for economic development programs. It aims to develop electronic links to databases containing relevant information on available economic development programs of the Federal Government. The Office of Economic Development Information aims to provide relevant information on economic development programs at the federal, state, and local levels, including contact details, application processes, eligibility requirements, economic data, and trends. The Office of Economic Development Information provides information on trade agreements, defense spending, technological change, economic development case studies, technology utilization programs, and resources for identifying capital sources for businesses. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources for identifying potential capital sources for businesses, understanding sustainable development, and ensuring public access to data services. The Office of Economic Development Information offers various means for public access to data services, including an Internet website, a toll-free telephone number, online electronic access, printed manuals, and periodic orientation workshops. The Office of Economic Development Information provides network services, computer database access, printed manuals, orientation workshops, and information specialists for assistance. The Secretary will coordinate with other federal departments and agencies. Economic development includes economic adjustment, disaster recovery, industrial retention, and defense reinvestment. Appropriations are authorized for this section.
